Reviews.Title: “Great Staff Hotel is very Clean”
Reviews.Author: raf s
Reviews.Content: Great experience here at Stay Waikiki, No Fridge, doesn't matter you go to a hotel to sleep anyway. Also be ready for some noise coming from buses picking up people and dropping them off all night... I would definitely recommend this hotel for the price compared the the high prices all around here.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely pleased!”
Reviews.Author: Laurennn_rose
Reviews.Content: We came to Oahu on a whim. We booked through Expedia with a flight & hotel package and was very pleased with our whole experience. We stayed at Stay Waikiki in a bunk bed room for 5 nights and have nothing but good comments. Now they weren't lying when they called it a boutique hotel, for it is very small, in fact our room was similar to a large walk-in closet but it was decorated nicely and had a small balcony that overlooked the city and a small part of the beach. Pros: - The price! - The comfortable lobby, including the best swinging chairs I have ever sat on! - The free amenities, including: inflatable floatation tubes, boogie boards, free DVD & PS2 games rental (PS2 comes with every room & flatscreen), wifi, pastries & coffee in the morning, etc. - The GREAT location. I'm talking a block away from everything! Waikiki Beach, the main restaurants, rental services, and since you are right behind the Hyatt all shuttles to Luaus, tours , etc pick you up basically from the Stay lobby! - The extremely helpful staff! Cons: - The room was tiny, but the decor made up for it and I mean, you're in Hawaii, why are you staying indoors?! - The large Hyatt blocking your beachfront view. *Some people complain about the noise, but it was not that bad. And the windows can be fully shut, but once again, it's Hawaii, let the ocean breeze flow in!!! Even at night. Seriously, so happy we STAYed here!

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is.”
Reviews.Author: julianhaami
Reviews.Content: Hi all. As the title says, it is what it is. It seemed to be an apartment block turned into a low price hotel / motel, think of it like business class for a backpacker. Dont expect luxury, its not what your paying for. The rooms are big enough (queen bed on 7th floor) although the bathroom is small but even at 6'6" it wasnt a big deal for me. If you want ocean views from your room dont bother, just walk 100m to the beach. PROS: The location is excellent and only a street back from Waikiki Beach, not even 100m away. Theres air con, a balcony, a bed, a tv, a playstation, wifi, a shower and a toilet. Staff were pleasant and helpful. The lobby is welcoming. The self service laundromat downstairs was very handy and something the bigger hotels could benefit from. CONS: Street noise that other reviews mention was noticeable, but i felt it was drowned out by the air con. Without refitting the entire hotel with new windows the noise will always be a problem for some. The curtains could be better and are about 60-70% efficient, but on the flip side Hawaii is a beautiful place so worthwhile getting up early anyway to take a stroll. No fridge in the room for cold drinks and snacks. TV placement would be a problem for some but a room for me on holiday is a place to sleep. Room wasnt ready for check in until 4pm, but we were able to sleep in the lobby on the comfy couches anyway and guzzle a couple beers purchased from the local ABC store, not so bad. OVERALL: Great value for money. Would happily stay again, you get what you pay for. If you want 4-5 star and all the fancy hotel jazz then load your credit card up and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “The noise killed the stay”
Reviews.Author: Sparrisen
Reviews.Content: We stayed because of the good price for the area, good reviews and the ok pictures. The stay was average. Not great because: - the noise starting at ca 5 a.m from the deliveries to the surrounding hotels, the windows are zero noise isolating so do take a good pair or air plugs unless you want to go up at five. (this is not a subject to floor, we stayed on floor 2 and 4 and both were equally noisy) -blackout drapes/curtains - there were curtains but far from black out... -the cleaning was so so. had to wipe the glass panel at the bead since some fat residue from the heads of the previous inhabitans still was there.. -beds not comfy at all -breakfast is symbolic.. we bought our own (but then again we are a bit picky eaters, so check with the other reviewers) -a bit unsafe feelind due to the very open nature of the entry lobby.. Not poor because: -location -price -friendly staff -no other hygienic incidents other than mentioned above Reading the positive reviews from the others it seems that the room standard might vary somewhat. If the only alternative option is staying at one of the nerby hotels for double or tripe the price then this hotel is ok since all what you really want to experience in the waikiki area is very near.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for me!!”
Reviews.Author: Martin1019
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasant 2 night stay here and will definitely come back again! I was a single traveller and ended up with a room with bunkbeds - which were fine and surprisingly comfy! The property was clean and fairly modern. The other guests were all very similar to me - young, adventurous, and personable. There were a few families there as well. Especially considering the price I paid (in reward points), this place was an awesome fine. ps- Air condition worked and it was close to everything

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not great”
Reviews.Author: knot93
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel for people that don't care about amenities. The location is perfect as far as being close to things (beach/Diamond head/shops/restaurants) but BEWARE - Koa is a busy street. Tour buses & other traffic come through there early & late, which makes it very loud. Room was cute but small & you can tell the building is old. The bathroom only had one small shelf (two girls w/makeup etc did not work!) & the only mirror was in the bathroom (so 2 people could not get ready at the same time). Continental breakfast was not good - only had little pastries & toast. Housekeeping was average (didn't empty garbage once or give us the correct amount of towels). Staff was nice and helpful. Free internet. Biggest complaint is the "resort fee" they charge. THIS IS NOT A RESORT. No pool, gym, bar, or free parking...what am I paying extra for???

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value!”
Reviews.Author: JM00
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at Stay Waikiki. Staff was extremely nice! Some other customers on the lower floors complained of the noise (Waikiki is inherently noisy). We we're perfectly fine in the back of the 2nd floor with the AC on all night anyway. Great location steps from the beach. Fair continental breakfast. Excellent value for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay. Great customer service!”
Reviews.Author: dntnid2knwmuah
Reviews.Content: Rooms are modern, clean and just the right size. Bed is very comfortable. Restrooms are clean. There were no stains so that's really good. Shower heads' design was like pouring rain. Staff were excellent. They were always greeting us and smiling. They were very helpful and accommodating as well. Free internet access, printer, DVDs, beach mats, umbrellas, chairs and floaters. You can request for a mini-fridge. Very comfortable couches in the lobby. Continental breakfast was good. They have breads w/ sausages inside and some breads have ham & cheese. Sometimes, they also have mini bread w/ spam & egg which was my favorite. Oh! You can bring breakfast up to your room. Plus, all other danish & coffee. We have balcony w/ partial ocean view (Room 608). We're heavy sleeper so we didn't have problem w/ outside noise. The only cons we have was when we requested for our rooms to be cleaned the floor wasn't swept one time, there was a little problem w/ the DVD player and the elevator door closes really fast. That's it! Other than that we would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced place to stay in Waikiki w/courteous staff.”
Reviews.Author: anntamura5
Reviews.Content: I was making a quick visit to Honolulu and didn't want to spend a lot on a place to stay in the Waikiki area. The Stay Hotel was reasonably priced, the rooms were very clean, and the staff was incredibly nice and helpful. If you need to park a car at the hotel make sure you arrange for that ahead of time because space is limited. Also, it is on a noisy street with a lot of delivery trucks, tourist buses, etc. But, the rooms have A/C which you can turn on at night to drown out the street noise. Beds are comfortable and the area felt safe. The hotel is in a great area for shopping, eating, and close to the beach. I am giving the hotel a "Very Good" because of the price, cleanliness, staff, and location. You can always pay more for more frills in that same area.

Reviews.Title: “Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tammi W
Reviews.Content: The Stay is perfectly located near the beach. It is clean and the staff is very helpful. Includes a continental breakfast and is also located near several other breakfast options. Beach towels and chairs are available.

Reviews.Title: “not too shabby......”
Reviews.Author: jackie_moo808
Reviews.Content: The staff is hands down the most down to earth & pleasant people that I have ever dealt with in a hotel!, (this includes $500+ a night New York hotel room where you would expect awesome service for the amount of moolah!!) the price was pretty darn decent especially for its great location! the continental breakfast was good for being free! the room had a ps2 in it and you could rent movies and games thru thier version of redbox all complementary! and the movies were up to date, there was free wifi that was provided, the hotel looks like it was a apartment building turned into a hotel, the only downside was that the floor was a bit sandy when we got arrived but hey there is a beach a hop skip and jump away so it wasnt uncommon, and the parking was tough! but we managed! and the AC unit was really low to the floor so the dresser enjoyed the cool air. But all in all I would definately stay here again if the price was right!

Reviews.Title: “Your travel thoughts and then reality!”
Reviews.Author: HeadsUp737
Reviews.Content: We have all done it, passing through a city so we think, I'll just get a low cost room for the one night, it should be OK, Well, the Stay Hotel is OK, but you get what you pay for so be careful! The best thing was the excellant help provided by a young woman working at the front desk (sorry I do not have her name) but she went to extra efforts to help us, even printing a map for us to help us find where we were having dinner. She was a big help, friendly and made the difference! The hotel itself is very simple and plain. Somewhat intimidating if you don't like looking at surfers in the next door buildings. But reeally no problems with them. So don't expect alot, except good service and a clean room and you'll be heppy. Warning, the downtown area around the hotel is a traffic mess! Road construction, streets closed, I'll never stay in that area agian. But again must give the front desk woman and night time desk workers pats on the back and say "Great Job" ! Finding something to eat no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great service”
Reviews.Author: Clair M
Reviews.Content: Stay Waikiki is located in a perfect spot and close to everything - beach, hotels, shops. The staff are very helpful and the service includes internet and breakfast - unlike most top end hotels. The room was clean and fresh - dvd's available too. Just a bit noisy. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and convenient to UH Manoa”
Reviews.Author: Denise I
Reviews.Content: So close to the best part of Waikiki Beach (Diamond Head side) with every conceivable amenity right outside your door. Watch amazing boogie boarding near the pier. Stay Hotel Waikiki is clean and modern for a reasonable price. Intimate, laid back with no fuss and everything you need. We found all of the staff to be friendly and helpful. Continental breakfast, daily newspaper, flat screen tv, internet access and WiFi were all nice amenities, but there is a daily amenity fee associated with these. Parking available. Just stayed with my 18 year old son who will be attending UH Manoa in the Fall, so this was an excellent location for us to quickly zip up to campus for appointments. Much more traffic congestion and heavier foot traffic going toward the Ala Moana side of Waikiki which makes Stay Waikiki's location very convenient if you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: kmschuch
Reviews.Content: Prime location, extremely friendly and helpful staff(Chris was especially good with advice), clean. Just what we needed for a few nights. construction going on in the alley made for noise early, but that should be done soon.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff!!! This Colorado girl will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: Kaipo12
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for what I needed. I was in town for only a couple of days. I picked this hotel based on the reviews stating that the staff was great. My experience with the staff was the best I have ever experienced. They were friendly and truly interested in me as a person. I had an unusual circumstance with my flight departure and the staff was helpful in figuring out a plan that would make my stay as easy as possible. The room was comfortable and I enjoyed the brightness of it. I will be returning to the hotel the next time I am in town and would recommend this hotel to my friends as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: majjj
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel: +the service is excellent +rooms are tidy +staff is super friendly. +overall state of the hotel is quite nice +i was able to change the reservation so that i left a couple of days early with just one day notice and they didn't charge me any extra. -breakfast served in the lobby from paper plates and cups and It was basically just toast and some pastries. -quite noisy: the walls are thin and the windows basically let all the noise thru. You don't here much noise from the other rooms, but if you have a room with the window on the corridor side you'll hear the people going pass so well. Only thing that bothered me was the noise, but i'm a heavy sleeper so it didn't bother me that much.

Reviews.Title: “Economical, Clean, Basic”
Reviews.Author: Babsiepoodles
Reviews.Content: The bad... *Since we had a rental car we had to purchase a space within the tiny garage for a $15 per night fee, as there was no other parking option. Luckily we got the last spot. That fee was on top of the **Our room had a balcony overlooking the apartment building directly next door. We had a running joke that there wasn't just 1 morning each week the garbage was picked up, it was every morning, as even though we were on the 5th floor, we could still hear everything from the street through the jalousie windows! ***The elevator needs to be replaced. It broke down twice while we were there. It's not cool when you have to climb the stairs twice in 1 morning & then attempt to surf. Admittedly the staff acknowledges this problem, but seems resigned that nothing will change any time soon. ****A duplicated $10 a night amenity fee that, even though it was included with our original pre-paid purchase price, was still tacked on at the end of our stay. Essentially making it $20 per day. The good... *This hotel is basic, clean, reasonably priced option about 2 blocks from the ocean. We stayed here for part of our stay on Oahu and choose this hotel as we knew we would not be spending much time in our room & more time exploring the island. **Free beach accessories to "steal" for a day: mats, inflatables and boogie boards. ***Newer Ikea furnishings within cosmetically freshened rooms. iHome docs for alarm clocks.

Reviews.Title: “Very Bad Experience at STAY (AWAY) HOTEL WAIKIKI”
Reviews.Author: Cat J
Reviews.Content: We booked the “Deluxe Queen with Sofa bed” for 4 nights. We arrived 5 mins after the check-in time to make sure that we were there early in case we had a “chance” to request for a room with lanai. Unfortunately, we didn’t have that “chance”. I was greeted by “Char”. After I told her my last name, she told me that my room had a problem about electricity (didn’t call us beforehand at all?!?). She relocated us to Aston Waikiki Beachside Hotel and booked “Partial Ocean View” room (with “breakfast”) for us. We were so tired from the flight and my husband was standing by in our rental car since the hotel parking was full, so I said “okay”. We found out when we arrived in the new hotel that we had a “Moderate Hotel Room” with balcony but no ocean-view at all, and there is no breakfast!!!!!! I called “Char ”and she said that the “Moderate Hotel Room” that she booked for us was “Bigger” than the “Deluxe Queen with Sofabed” room at Say Hotel Waikiki!?!?!?!?! She also said all the rooms at Stay Hotel didn’t have ocean-view neither. No mention anything about breakfast!!! I was so upset about this unprofessional big liar. But again, we were so tired and not in the situation that we were ready to fight for our right. We hate the fact that Stay Hotel didn’t try to contact us before we arrived. The hotel staff intentionally gave me the incorrect information and just wanted us to go away! So “STAY-AWAY” from STAY (AWAY) Hotel Waikiki, if you don’t want to have a bad experience like us!

Reviews.Title: “Economy Bliss”
Reviews.Author: SomnioAmo
Reviews.Content: Went for a quick budget getaway to Hawaii with a friend and found this gem of a hotel. It is a newly renovated building, not fancy, but done nicely. Everything is new and modern, great decor. You can tell the building is old here and there, but this is what is to be expected with budget and the area. The location is absolutely perfect. Short walk to everywhere in the area and close to bus stops for getting to further areas. A little over a block to Waikiki Beach, right across from the Hyatt. The staff was amazing and always helpful! They were so personable and always willing to help! Even the cleaning staff was sure to always smile and help in any way. The lobby of the hotel is a nice area to relax between outings or in the morning. This is where breakfast is served (assortment of pastries, breads, juices). Plenty of plush, new sofas, canopy chairs and TV. They also have a business area for guest use, a collection of beach accessories (chairs, mats, floaties) and free DVD/video game rentals! All of this and wi-fi is included in the $10/day additional fee. The room was great, everything we needed. Very clean, awesome new decor and a balcony with table and chairs. There was a flat-screen TV and iPod docking station. We had bunk beds and they were very comfortable. The bathroom was quite small, and there wasn't much light in the shower. However, it was clean and served its purpose. We never had the noise issues others have described, but we were on a high floor. Keep in mind, this is a budget-oriented place. There is no restaurant (although they are in the process of adding one) and no pool. You are not going to get luxury, but you are also paying an amazing price for being right in Waikiki. I would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Location is fantastic, but indeed noisy”
Reviews.Author: Ice_D_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights here. The location is fantastic, literally one block back from Waikiki Beach. The room was decent and clean, however, with a nearby Motor Enthusiasts club and the Tour Bus pickup point for the Hyatt Regency over the road, it is indeed noisy! The noise was just manageable for me, but do bring earplugs. The staff were friendly and helpful. Finally, the internet access and morning breakfast comes with the $10/night ‘hotel fee’ – the internet access was good, the breakfast was limited in range. Overall, it's this hotel location that is the biggest draw card.

Reviews.Title: “Waikiki's Angels”
Reviews.Author: uabelle04
Reviews.Content: I am a flight attendant who just got based in Honolulu and couldn't find a place that was reasonable priced, clean, and with a friendly staff until I came to Stay Waikiki. I original only planned to stay here for a couple of nights however, after I got here I immediately extended my stay until the end of the month. The rooms are super clean, the beds are comfortable, it's close to the beach and easy to get to the bus station. I loved the staff. They are so kind and helpful. And the manager was so accommodating. By far the best place to stay in Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “For the price, it was exactly what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Juanbuddha
Reviews.Content: Okay, is this place great? Not, not really. But for our purposes of having a place to crash after a day of hiking and exploring Oahu, this place was perfect. Similar to what some people have said, the rooms can be a bit small but we were lucky enough to be upgraded to a larger room for our two nights there. Score! I will also verify some of the other comments people have said: it is indeed next to a budget hostel which could be noisy. We were there just after Spring Break so the place was empty and not really an issue for us. The early morning garbage trucks are real and will show up 6 am or so like clockwork. The windows are glass slat types that will keep water out but not much noise. Depending on your expectations of a hotel, these things may bother you but for the two of us, they were non issues. We both slept with earplugs, making all of these things a non factor during our stay. One other thing of note is that the bathroom was on the interior of the building so all the steam from your shower would have to escape out into the room once you opened the door. I am always puzzled by places that don't have a fan or put the bathroom with small window to the outside to let fresh air in. All of that stuff said, it was an absolute steal for what we paid (we did a bundle with a car from a main travel site that was wayyy cheaper than booking both separately). We did have a car rental as well, which we parked about 3 blocks away at Hotel Banyan for $10 per 24 hrs with in/out privileges. There was a sign up that this was increasing to $12 effective June 1st 2012. The 3 block walk didn't bother us but if you have limited mobility or kids, walking back to hotel may bother you. Breakfast is white bread, unfrozen muffins/pastries, jam, juice and coffee. You don't want to fill up on the stuff but it will let you eat something before you begin your day, which is convenient. Service was great, with each staff member being super nice. There is an ABC store about 3 doors down for late night drinks and munchies, a Mexican restaurant that has happy hour about 5 doors down and the beach is about a 2 minute walk from the place. Can't really complain about the location as it was pretty much perfect. I can see how if you're here at the wrong time of year, this place would be brutal. But for us, I'll chalk it up to a bit of luck and knowing what we were getting ourselves into. T'was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Juliet A
Reviews.Content: Things in Hawaii are overpriced, period. It is hard to get a good bargain on certain things, especially in Waikiki, where everything caters to tourists. However, Stay Waikiki is a great little gem that disproves the idea that a deal can't be had. My husband and I had been staying at the Hilton (paid for in part by his work, in part by our Hilton rewards), but when we ran out of free nights, we needed somewhere cheap to stay for the last few nights. Really, we weren't looking for a regular "hotel" - we just needed a place to lay our heads at night (who spends a lot of time in their hotel rooms anyway when you are in the most beautiful place in the world?!). Stay Waikiki fit all of our criteria: helpful staff, modest yet clean rooms, great location, and a fantastic rate. No suites were available when we booked, but we got a double room for $89/night, plus a $10/night resort fee, which includes free newspapers, free breakfast (pastries and coffee and juice), free wi-fi internet and use of printer, and free DVD rentals. Also, the hotel has plenty of beach toys you can borrow, ranging from straw beach mats to boogie boards. People of all ages - traveling singles, young families, and older couples - stayed here during our 2 nights, so this breaks the mold of being a "budget" or even "dorm" lodging. The room: bed was comfortable for two, we had a mini-fridge, plenty of storage room, a breakfast table and sofa bed, and a small (clean, but badly in need of an upgrade) bathroom. The wi-fi works great in the room. We only got 2 towels total, but there is maid service daily which will replenish your supplies. Downsides: we could hear entire conversations coming in from the vent in our room from some other room (I think from right above us, it was difficult to tell) and there was a huge gap in between our door and the floor (as in, 2-3 inches space). No bugs or anything got in, but still, a bit off-putting. I wouldn't stay here for a long period of time, but for a couple of nights, Stay Waikiki really fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Bare Essentials”
Reviews.Author: Michael L
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1 block from Waikiki beach and shopping. Staff friendly and helpful. Continental breakfast. Cons: Bare bones accommodations. Room furnishings are austere at best but all necessary items are present. No chair/table in room but plastic chair on balcony can be brought in. Housekeeping consists of bathroom cleanup, clean towels each day but no clean linens. Hotel is on a street which is the loading zone for the neighboring Hyatt Regency Hotel and even tho I was on the 5th floor there was significant loading noise 24/7 primarily from tour buses loading/unloading. Hotel has parking for only 10 cars. Arrived with auto and had to search for a garage in vicinity since the Hotel garage was full. I was able to get a spot in the hotel garage for $15/day on the 2nd day of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Suck of Stay Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: tommy w
Reviews.Content: I just got here today and got a room at the 3rd floor. The room's window was not sealed and it was really really really noisy all day and night. I couldn't sleep in this room. And I go to front desk to change another room, they always tell me the hotel was full. But I don't think so, I think they just don't wanna give me the new room. I think the stuff just want to save the "trouble". And every room has to pay 10 dollar for every night you stay. This is not charged until the final day. And I can't feel any privacy when I stay in the room because the window close to the walkway is not sealed and I really think it is not safe enough. Anyway, if let me choose again, I will not choose this hotel again. I will rather pay more to stay at other hotel. Don't be cheated by the pictures from the website.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Danielle E
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this place! It is so close to the beach and near everything close to Waikiki Beach. Had a decent continental breakfast and it has DVDs and games at the desk that you can play in your room. The best part of this place is the staff who go out of their way to help you and to be friendly. I ask a lot of questions and they were very patient with me for our entire stay. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Julie T
Reviews.Content: Breakfast needs improvement, it would be nice to have a variety or something different everyday . Nothing fancy ,simple would be ok. If you stay there for more than 3 days, you will keep on eating the same thing every morning. Since you are charging 10 bucks per day anyways, might as well improve. Room also needs a small fridge for leftovers . Staff was superb, friendly and accomodating. It is hard to sleep in the morning from 4-6 am since it is very noisy outside...but it is walking distance to waikiki beach.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation In Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: Michael N
Reviews.Content: I did a last minute trip to Waikiki and I needed something inexpensive but up to date. I seriously lucked out. I love this place! The hotel is clean, simple, and cute! I enjoy the simple things and love that this place has that for me. The balcony is cute also! I love that they have free wifi and free movie rentals!

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere near "Boutique" Flair”
Reviews.Author: Gold11LA_California
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights while visiting the island of Oahu. We choose this hotel because it looked like a cool, trendy, contemporary place! Plus it describes itself as a "boutique hotel". But it seems that every hotel which has contemporary & trendy furniture (Ikea) and less than 50 bedrooms can call itself a "boutique hotel". However if you find a dirty and filthy carpet in your bedroom, a not up to standard cleaned bathroom, floor and furniture’s you WILL question the description named above. The room and the hotel itself felt more like a hostel, rather than a hotel! The staff at the front desk were friendly, however not very well trained or confident. Also it felt that they did not want to go the extra mile to make their guests feel 100% comfortable. This is why after listening to a conversation the receptionist had with another guest while waiting to be served we decided not to bother with "feedback" about the room and our "discomfort" as we thought that there wasn't much they can or want to do about it anyway. I guess because this hotel does not have a lot of returning leisure guests as most of them are tourists visiting from all over the world, and "Stay Hotel Waikiki" doesn't strike me as the place to hold functions, conferences or to be attractive for business people, the interest in keeping every customer happy didn't seemed to be top priority. We paid $10.00 per night amenities fee, which includes breakfast, wireless internet, use of the guest computer, comp. newspapers available in the lobby and coffee served (help yourself service) throughout the day. Ok, it is what it is and even if we didn't want to make use of any of this we still had to pay it. The breakfast was "served" on plastic plates and cutlery in the lobby on two tables next to the elevator and included toast, jam, butter, Danish & tea/coffee, with seats available (or not) in the lobby. We couldn't find the restaurant/bar. However two blocked of doors where we were able to store our luggage and looked like a building site is probably where it will be eventually once it's finished. The good thing about this hotel is its location, just one block away from Waikiki Beach and close to bus routes going into every direction. The bad thing is the noise...but we were well aware that if you book a city center hotel, you will not get a lot of sleep, so NOT really the hotels fault. (We brought our earplugs beforehand) Would we stay here again? Only for one night maybe and if I didn't had to pay the full rack rate, so watch out for special offers or lower your expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: sicng
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel with my 21 years old son and his best friend. I have booked a deluxe queen room with balcony. However, when we checked it, we were given a room with no balcony and lower level ( which you could hear lots of noises ). Have asked to change, but the answer was full hotel! The stuff, specially the front desk, was the nicest people. You do feel welcomed by them. The room was clean when we checked in. However, on the five nights that we stayed there, housekeeping did a really lousy job. The floor was half cleaned, there was sand and dust on all corners. The bathtub was never cleaned ( tub got dirtier and darker). The toilet seat was never cleaned either, I have to clean it with clorox wipes. The extra pillow that I have requested has blood stain. It was really disgusting. My expectaction was low when I read all the reviews. I have even brought a lock with me since there is no in room safe. However, I did not expect the room to be so untidy!!! Hope they will improve on that aspect to make it more desirable hotel. The location of the hotel is really close to the beach, and the stuff is super super nice. It would have been a nice inexpensive hotel to stay if only they have much cleaner rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, Clean & Friendly & CLOSE to surf!”
Reviews.Author: jane i
Reviews.Content: We got a room here last minute for a surf getaway. The hotel is like a block from the waikiki surf and it was excellent. we would definitely recommend it. Spartan room, but worked perfect for our needs. Very clean!

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Peter P
Reviews.Content: A little background - the purpose of my trip was a 2-day stop on Oahu to see a house that I wanted to buy. Since I didn't have the wife and kid and would be busy all day, I opted for the cheapest hotel I could find in Waikiki that had decent reviews on TripAdvisor. Stay Waikiki had an Expedia deal for a $90 a night room with bunk beds, so I went with them. A couple issues I had: 1) parking - there is VERY limited parking available at the hotel, and the staff said that there was $8/night parking available at the adjacent building. The actual price for parking had changed to $20/night unbeknownst to the staff, so I had to correct them. 2) room - I've stayed in some cramped rooms before, but this was one of the smallest I had ever seen. The bunk bed was also very cheap, like used dorm furniture. 3) fees - there is some kind of $10/night fee for. . . I don't know what. I noticed a warning for it after I booked the Expedia deal, so I think Stay should just put it in the base price of the room 4) loud - the walls aren't well insulated and this is one of the noisiest parts of Waikiki due to buses and service trucks pulling in behind the Waikiki Hyatt Regency, so it was pretty noisy all night Otherwise the hotel was fine and served its purpose of giving me a place to crash. The room was very clean its VERY close to EVERYTHING in Waikiki, so you won't be at a loss for places to eat or things to do. I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling with friends on a budget and relying on public transportation. I would not recommend this to anyone travelling with a family or looking for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place!”
Reviews.Author: bellaluna12345
Reviews.Content: I was a bit skeptical when I was first looking at this hotel because of the small rooms and the no pool aspect. But I was really happy with the experience. The hotel is cheap, which is great, the location is great (1 block from the beach and right in the middle of all the awesomeness that Waikiki has to offer). My hubs and I figured what did the hotel we stay at matter since we didn't plan on being in the hotel anyways. We actually ended up staying in more than we thought! The windows are these frosted glass panes that you can control to open or close. It gave the room a feel like we were in Thailand or Indonesia or something. The room was small, sure, but totally livable and I like the modern colors. And best of all were the people at the front desk. They were sooooo nice and helpful and trust me we were a pain. They were always smiling and friendly and they are what made this place a place where I would stay again. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent alternative in Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: Journeyma
Reviews.Content: Stay hotel is a great alternative for people traveling to Waikiki, the rooms are recently renovated and are quite large. All necessities are available friendly reception, wifi in the rooms and Stay is situated only 3 minutes from the main beach and shopping street. On top of that Stays room rates are quite low and incl. breakfast :) All in all I highly recommend Stay hotel (especially for younger travelers - 35)

Reviews.Title: “Great trip on Oahu”
Reviews.Author: Seth_Montreal
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a quality hotel. I visited Oahu with my wife and we had a great time. The room was tidy and comfortable. We had our own balcony and the hotel was located near Waikiki beach. We only had bunk beds to sleep in, but we also looked for the least expensive option during our stay. We had our own bathroom, the staff was friendly and I would absolutely suggest this place to anyone looking for a great vacation on a smaller budget.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Missymays
Reviews.Content: Don't expect too much from this hotel, its a cheaply renovated concrete block apartment. basic double bed, no fridge. Room access via outside balcony. Staff are very nice

Reviews.Title: “Whitewashed dorm room in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: HD_Thoreau
Reviews.Content: The location is good, but the room is small. The bathroom is very cramped with little space to spread out. The balcony is nice, but some may not like the bunk bed arrangement. WiFi is fast. One negative is that the hotel adds a mandatory $10 per day amenity fee which is extra on top of the Internet room rate. Breakfast consists of toast, rolls, pineapple juice and coffee. They do provide an iHome and game system, and daily paper.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent hotel”
Reviews.Author: pabletengue
Reviews.Content: Although it's an economical hotel, it's very recomendable. Great location, very clean, very nice the people who works at the front desk. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Honolulu in late February”
Reviews.Author: gearybrewer
Reviews.Content: I visit Honolulu with my friends during the last week of February. We have been doing this trip for 20 years with a 4 or 5 years missed here and there. The point is that we have stayed in many different hotels, condos, and beachfront properties. The Stay, for us, provided a good location for our activities. The parking provided was convenient as well. The staff is working diligently to create an atmosphere of aloha hospitality and it was appreciated. Every little request was well received and accommodated, such as an extra pillow. The computer availability and the wi-fi were welcome benefits. I enjoyed the clean room, the high-end linens, and retro tiled showers (thank your for not tearing out the tile - good greenies!) My suggestions would be to add fruit to the morning menu, a small refrigerator in the room, and free massages. OK, the last one is a stretch, but the first two would be a great addition! Thank you to the Staff and my apologies for posting this three weeks after our visit!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient economy hotel to central Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: popupLaird
Reviews.Content: Stay Waikiki, within easy walking distance to the Waikiki beach and seaside pavillions, is also reasonably priced. Rooms are clean and staff, friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great concept, not so great execution”
Reviews.Author: SailSD
Reviews.Content: I love the concept of this hotel, but they need to continue to work on it. Stayed 1 night - the staff could not have been friendlier and the location was great. But the room looked like they simply painted the old college dorm room, added a new bed and that was it. All the bath fixtures were original equipment. There was no nightstand, and I brought in the little patio table to use as a luggage rack. I paid their internet rate of $109/night and should have gone through one of the discounters - with the parking ($15) and the "amenities fee" ($10 - was at a loss as to what that was for, but apparently it was for the continental breakfast and the free wi-fi) and taxes the room ended up costing over $150! I wish them well but won't stay there again until some upgrades are made.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for What You Pay”
Reviews.Author: Asia_Trip_Reviewer
Reviews.Content: We were a bit skeptical of this hotel, since it used to be a college dormitory. But we like to take a chance on hotels that have been recently remodeled. Some other recently remodeled hotels we've stayed at: Waikiki Pearl and Queen Kapiolani. Whether we stay at a hotel like the Four Seasons or an economy hotel, we still want clean rooms. This hotel passes the "clean room" test. For the location and cleanliness, you get good value. Consider it like a well-runned Hampton Inn... except in Waikiki. Please note that I'm basing the experience on the upgraded room. ++++ Staff is very attentive and personable. Way better than staying at a 1,000 room resort, where nobody knows you. Responded to clogged tub drain issue immediately. $10 resort/ day fee is fair and gives you internet (works about 80% of the time), dvd rentals, and use of beach mats, chairs, floats; daily newspaper; (typical) continental breakfast of juice, coffee, toast, and pastries; a business area, so you can print boarding passes, use the internet. Very close to the Beach. You're smack right in the middle of the Waikiki strip. 10 minute walk to the zoo, one way and 10 minute walk to Beachwalk (Lewers) the other way. Restaurants are plentiful nearby. I prefer that small hotel buildings don't have restaurants, because I may be stuck in the room right above the restaurant (you can hear the noise and smell the kitchen.) Very convenient to the bus stops. We take the bus everywhere when we stay in Waikiki. Laundry facilities available - wash is only $1 and 45-minute dry is 75 cents. - - - - If you're a large-sized person, the bathroom may be an issue. It is tiny... like 15 SF. (You can wash your sandy feet while you're sitting on the toilet.) We're not large, so it worked out okay. And who hangs out in the bathroom? Couldn't quite figure out if hotel is being "green" or staff just forgot to make it to our rooms and get us new towels. We usually fix our own bed, and re-use our towels (because that's what we do at home), but it was stretching it a bit, when all towels got used up (because we went to the beach) and trash bin was overflowing. For those who complain about noise... you're in the middle of Waikiki, which is a very popular area. You can stay at the Royal Hawaiian for $350 - $400 per night if you want quiet. Recommendation to hotel: 1) get wifi to work fulltime 2) include the fairly priced resort fee in the nightly room rate; we like to prepay our vacations beforehand, so the resort fee was a bit of surprise. 3) Fix the elevator's door sensor. The elevator door's closing too quickly will maim somebody one of these days.

Reviews.Title: “Great value fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: NWBC
Reviews.Content: Great value and location, just make sure you bring ear plugs if you're a light sleeper. Tour buses for the Hyatt are across the street and are quite loud in the mornings. Staff is very friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “A cozy stay in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Christine H
Reviews.Content: Stay is a boutique hotel for people who are looking for something comfortable but nothing really fancy. The location is the biggest plus factor to this hotel and the staff as well. Most of the other hotels in the area are large chain hotels and therefore much more expensive. Our room was mostly used just for sleeping as we were out exploring Waikiki but we also enjoyed some drinks on our small balcony. The downside to this hotel is that the bathroom is VERY small. It might not work well for a family. The breakfast consisted of juice, coffee, tea and some pastries. Nothing really special but it was free! Also, the elevators are in need of an update. I was painfully caught in between the doors! The staff were very courteous and helpful at this hotel. They were always willing to offer information especially for local transit and they were quick to get us ice whenever we needed it. They also let us use their computers and phone when we were trying to find tickets for a New Years Eve Party. This is a great option if you're only planning on spending a few nights in Waikiki. If this is your main destination in Hawaii you may want to consider more of a resort style hotel with restaurant options and a pool. However, there are many restaurants within walking distance as well as the beach which is just 2 blocks away! Just a tip: local calls are NOT free!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Stay Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: poiboi82
Reviews.Content: excellent staff and the rooms are clean. simple, small but all the value. excellent location. a little noisy in the early morning because its behind the bigger hotels but nonetheless a great find!!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem a block from the beach”
Reviews.Author: localboy66
Reviews.Content: Flew in for a short trip & was looking or a good budget hotel in Waikiki. Did some web surfing & came upon Stay Waikiki. Location looked great for the price so we took a chance & booked it. We were more than pleasantly surprised & extremely happy with our stay. The hotel sits behind the Hyatt next to Kings Row. It appears to once have been an apartment, converted to be a small boutique hotel circa 1950's. They did a complete remodel, is tastefully appointed & is squeaky clean (our pet peeve). They even had an Ipod docking/charging unit & flatscreen TV & new remote control AC unit. The only thing I see they should have done was to change the bathroom fixtures. Our room was small but for the price & location, who can complain. We walked to all the Waikiki restaurants, shopping & beach with ease. They have an excellent continental breakfast every morning. The staff was excellent & friendly. Parking is limited for $15 but there is also public parking at Kings Row down the street for $8 a day- no in & out privliges. You don't really need a car if you do most of your activities in Waikiki. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone on a budget & want to be a block to the beach amongst the high end hotels. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: budgetqueen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights, Feb, 2012. Had a very nice room, super clean, comfortable beds- twin room. OK breakfast of juice, tea, coffee, toast, muffins etc., very basic, but replenished frequently, and out early. Parking is very limited and far better with an economy car. It is easy walking distance to many attractions, food options, beach. It is a noisy location, so if of any issue, this won't be a good hotel choice. My priority was price, of which this hotel delivered. :)

Reviews.Title: “Simple”
Reviews.Author: kat60982
Reviews.Content: This hotel was simple. No fridge in room (unless advised before visiting, and only if they havent run out), no kettle, coffee, tea or water in room or available after 10.00am in lobby. Also, may of the rooms features were broken or needed repair (bathroom window, dvd player, ceiling light). Extra $10.00 amenity fee charged evey day of your stay which is not advised anywhere when booking (charge is for wireless internet, dvd rental and daily breakfast of a toast or mini pasteries and coffee). Coffee and water was not provided (after 10:00am).Parking costs $15.00 a day (and only if they havent run out of spaces). Good news; Internet is accessible all day via computers in lobby as well as a printer (which you do not have to pay any extra for) and an ATM machine... Customer Service was good, staff are polite and somewhat helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy.”
Reviews.Author: taurinus
Reviews.Content: Does not have regular windows,they are glass blinds you can hear everything from the street. There is very limited parking. I had to park 2 blocks away. They also charge a 10couple Dlls amenity fee. Will never go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Hotel is great”
Reviews.Author: Paul E
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed nine nights at the Stay Hotel on Waikiki Beach Hawaii and it was a great experience. The price is very reasonable, the rooms are simple but adequate, the location is good and the staff is VERY friendly. The only aspect that could use improvement is the continental breakfast which is sub par but otherwise we have no faults with this hotel. The place is a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location, good value.”
Reviews.Author: mjgriffy
Reviews.Content: Preface: While I stayed in a nearby condominium, my friends stayed at Stay for a week and had a wonderful time. My return flight was overbooked, so I called Stay and they made a room for me for 3 days. Service: Front desk staff is mostly outstanding. Warm, friendly, accommodating and helpful--they are the personification of the Aloha Spirit. Daily housekeeping is quietly efficient and respectful. Location: Premium. In the shadow of The Hyatt, in the middle of Waikiki, 1 block to the beach, and walking distance to all things local. Rooms: Clean and small. My top/8th floor unit was a quiet room with single bunk beds. Linens and beds are fresh and comfortable. I believe all units have balconies. I would not want to stay a week in a room this small, especially if I was traveling with someone, but for others it might be ok. My only suggested improvements: Coffee maker and mini fridge in room. Amenities: Not much. But there is free morning coffee in the lobby, ice, parking on a first-come fee basis, and beach gear available. Free Wi-Fi was jankey and unreliable. Summary: Clean rooms and an outstanding staff, at a reasonable price, makes this hotel a good value and a recommended place to stay. As always; I travel to Waikiki several times a year, I can advise that Waikiki is a nice tropical urban adventure. The city comes with the negatives of a big city, along with the overwhelming benefits of a beautiful beachfront resort. Generally, everything in Waikiki is “a little tired” although there have been continuous improvements in the last few years. If you are traveling solo, take Roberts Hawaii from the airport (no rsvr rqd). Two or more people, take a taxi from the airport to the hotel (should be under $40). In Waikiki, nearly everything is walking distance or a short shuttle/bus away. If you need a car for the day, you can rent one in Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff, amazing location! We will come back.”
Reviews.Author: Steve K
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a simple hotel, in the heart of Waikiki in the best location possible; however it is no frills at the Stay Hotel. The rooms are clean, the beds are comfortable enough, the highlight is the amazing staff - Jazmine made our trip in so many ways, with great tips on island hot spots and absolutely outstanding customer service! We were so pleased with the value and the location, plus the staff, enough to return to this hotel in the future. There are rooms that have "slat windows" in the bathrooms only, some have them in the bedroom as well - the rooms that do not have the slat windows in the bedrooms are quieter... You are in the heart of Waikiki and next to the busiest tour pickup (at the Hyatt) so be prepared for a lot of noise starting at 7am, but it is probably one of the best locations on the strip with one of the nicer beaches 1/2 block from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay close to everthing”
Reviews.Author: otis94
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 days. The rooms were very clean and fresh. All the staff were absolutely great especailly Jazmine. She was always there to help. We stayed on the 8th floor. Continental breakfast was included each day. A good way to start your day. You can't ask for a better location close to everything. Price was the best you could find anywhere in the surrounding area. Would stay there any time I was staying in Waikiki. Only one problem if you are a late riser it gets quite noisy after 7 am. Otherwise was geat.

Reviews.Title: “close to beach”
Reviews.Author: Marci M
Reviews.Content: I will return good value. freee rafts to take to beach Very nice

Reviews.Title: “Great location; no frills accommodation with thoughtful extras”
Reviews.Author: Kousnzca
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed 10 nights at Stay Waikiki. I was a little bit hesitant prior to booking as there were limited reviews about the hotel. Stay Waikiki is a small hotel with an awesome location (right behind the Hyatt, between the two towers on Koa Avenue). The beach and the main strip Kalakaua Ave are both 1 block away and there are ABC stores on both ends of the block (and around every corner of every block) for water, beer, snacks, snorkeling gear and Hawaii souvenirs. We had a standard queen bedroom, which included a lanai with a sliver of an oceanview. Room had AC, flatscreen TV, adequate closet space with drawers, and a very dated, small bathroom. The bathroom was probably my least favourite part of the hotel but not significant enough to ruin my stay. It was quite noisy especially early in the morning, as tour buses start loading and unloading right on Koa Avenue, in the back of the Hyatt. They also have service trucks on the other end of the hotel, which are just as loud. This is not the hotel's fault but just to keep in mind if you are a light sleeper. The hotel offers free complimentary breakfast daily, free wi-fi (connection was spotty at times) and has limited self-parking available at a first-come, first-serve basis for $15/day. We chose to park at the Waikiki Banyan (on Ohua and Kuhio) instead for $60/week with unlimited in-and-out privileges. They also have washer/dryer machines available for use at a cost. You can purchase single dose packets of laundry detergent and dryer sheets at the ABC store. Housekeeping staff were very hardworking and front desk staff could not be nicer. They were always happy to see you and offered very helpful insight about all things Oahu. Some constructive feedback for the hotel would be to better display the various extras that are available to the hotel guests, for example, washer/dryer usage, parking, fridge, iron, ice, DVD rental, printing services, etc. Almost all of our "extra" requests were met; we just had to ask for them as we didn't know if they were offered. It would be helpful for the guests to know that they have all of these extra services and amenities available - maybe via a pamphlet or sign. I would recommend this hotel on the condition that you don't expect more than what you are paying for; it is a clean, no frills hotel with all the basic necessities (and some extras).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the on-the-go traveler”
Reviews.Author: RAnderson1507
Reviews.Content: If you want plan on spending a lot of time in your room, this is the perfect hotel! The service is excellant and willing to help you find all the hidden local treasures along with the touristy stuff. Located one block behind the strip, one block from the beach, its perfect; comfort quality and price!

Reviews.Title: “In The Heart of Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: nd2spdn
Reviews.Content: Checking in to the hotel was a pleasant experience. I think Jasmine did an excellent job assisting us and was very knowledgeable with giving information within the Waikiki area. We unknowingly made reservations for a room with 2 bunkbeds and she immediately upgraded us to a room with a queen bed. No questions asked. The room was clean and cozy but there was no refrigerator, no coffee maker, and no microwave. But there are so many places to eat within close walking distance to soothe any appetite. The beach is a block away, lots of places for shopping, and bars/clubs for night life. Hotel parking is $15/day on a first come, first served basis. No reserved parking or assigned stalls. But there are other hotels or parking structures with in walking distance for fee. I would recommend to all. Mahalo to all at Stay Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “First stay @ STAY WAIKIKI.”
Reviews.Author: Cnv56
Reviews.Content: Warm welcome by a very busy one person front desk clerk JASMINE. Assisting others before us & welcoming us assisting our check-in, also helping another couple with parking issues all @ one time giving us her total attention. Made reservations online unknowingly we selected BUNK BED but were able to get a queen size bed. No fridge or coffee pot. Good stay tthouggg.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice & clean spot just off Waikiki Beach!”
Reviews.Author: Dale A
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Dec 24-28 and it was a very good stay! I upgraded to a queen room + sitting area and was pleasantly surprised! Extra space was REALLY nice, wifi access was good, and the wall of windows allowed for a good breeze! Add to it that I was 1 block off the Waikiki strip, and it was a bargain! This hotel works great for 1-2 travelers on a budget! Drawbacks were few, but the bathroom was small & dated and the cross breeze was best w/ door open.

Reviews.Title: “Here's what you need to know.”
Reviews.Author: joojanta
Reviews.Content: Know before you go. I would give 2.5 points but rounded down because I was given the runaround. We were hesitant to book anything besides our "regular", well known hotel where we always stay. The STAY WAIKIKI had good deals, was newly renovated, had only few but good reviews, so we gave it a shot. Here's what you need to know before you book, and if you decide to go with it, what to look for when you arrive. 1) The hotel is newly renovated and has a clean feel overall with modern styling elements and contrasty colors. The rooms have wood laminate floors. The baths are tiny. The fixtures are not updated, but are acceptable. In my room when sitting on the bowl, I could rest my chin on the sink. One could see that as a plus, or minus. Showers were completely tiled, which I prefer over silicone sealed plastic tubs. I was wary about the little brown crawling insects after some of the reviews, but did not see ANY in the 9 days I was there. 2) ONLY FLOORS 5 THROUGH 8 have balconies aka Lanais. So if you check in and expect a room with a balcony, make sure it's on floor 5 or higher and explicitely ask for a DELUXE (if that's what you booked). I'd also say from floor 6 and up you get a good view. The hotel is so narrow that it's only one room wide, meaning every entrance is on one side, every window or balcony is on the other (towards Diamond Head). 3) The tricky part is to catch a DELUXE room WITH a lanai. The supply here is limited. We booked a deluxe with lanai explicitly and they gave us a standard with lanai. After pointing this out, they moved us to a deluxe without lanai on floor 4, which we declined - terrible view and no lanai. We eat take-out on our lanai and rely on it. The "booking system did also not allow for predicting when the next deluxe WITH lanai gets available" - really, guys? Really? Well if you can't predict how long a room is taken, then I understand that the reservation system also does not allow for you to RESERVE me a deluxe with lanai, which is what I had booked in the first place. Ok, how stupid do you think I am. It's the age of computers. And luckily, also the age of tripadvisor reviews. 4) The DELUXE rooms are MUCH bigger than the standard. The standard is a shoe box. In the Deluxe you have room to breath. I saw both rooms, and believe me. You want the DELUXE SIZE, WITH lanai. 5) The parking garage is tiny and holds about 8-10 cars with only 2 spots allowing for full size cars or bigger. I'd say one or 2 spots can hold mini vans. I took the small spots with my Chevy Cobalt rental leaving the bigger ones for the minivans and had to maneuver multiple times to get in and out. NO KIDDING. Oh, btw, parking was "full" when we arrived and we were immediately advised that we have to park off site. $8 without in-and-out privileges. They used this as a bargaining chip later though (AHA!) and suddenly parking was available (and complimentary which was very nice, so thanks for this plus). 6) The staff is friendly, absolutely. But they are advised by their management to give you the runaround when it comes to giving you what you booked. I feel for them, but if you don't get your reservation system fixed it will be a returning problem. Again, we did book the DELUXE WITH LANAI and WE DID NOT GET IT. We're still on the phone daily with Expedia to get a refund. What a hassle. Had we known that, we would have gone with our "old" hotel where we know what we get into (which floor, which room, parking, staff etc). Again, friendly staff at the STAY, but the underlying theme was still visible which is giving you the runaround until you give up. If I have a week off, do I want to have a hassle with the front desk FOR TWO THIRDS of my vacation only so that I can get what I booked AND PAID FOR, only two days before I leave? No. And management knows that. Listen, management. Customers have a pretty good antenna for when they are given the runaround. No, I will not recommend this hotel to my friends, because of that. 7) Location is awesome. We saw whales from our lanai and you're right in the middle of things. I do prefer Hawaii in summer though. It's lush, greener, warmer, and smells better with the ginger and plumeria in bloom and the hala fruit falling. Less guava though in summer. It also seems like there are a little less tourists in summer. 8) IT IS LOUD even with closed windows and sliding doors. I had to use ear plugs every night, which was expected and is normal in the middle of the city. If you have been to Waikiki, you know that. If it will be your first time, be advised that you can't escape the sounds of the streets, nighlife, reversing buses, barking. Anywhere except in a high rise building on floors 15 and up (be advised, there you might have helicopter sounds).

Reviews.Title: “Best for the price”
Reviews.Author: Ivv_10
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Clean and near everything in waikiki (including beach and crowdy shops and restaurants). A little noisy, but it's not that bad (I'm a really light sleepper and I sleep with earplug). For now, best hotel in waikiki for the price. (but don't know when the price will be higher). Front desk workers are nice and helpful (the ones we have talked to). Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Runaround in Waikiki - AVOID”
Reviews.Author: Anna G
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms with BALCONIES for 2 nights at Stay Hotel, I was given 2 rooms without balconies. When I addressed this issue at the front desk they claimed not to have any available rooms with balconies - hello it's called a RESERVATION! The hotel staff was clueless about how to resolve this issue and said I would have to check with the manager. I came to the front desk 5 times in the course of 2 days to seek out the ever elusive manager - he never showed up! If you book here, it's a good location, but it's so bare bones that the bathroom's don't even have a mirror! Also hotel website claims to have complimentary breakfast - that's false too! So basically if you're looking for an uncomfortable motel with non-existent customer service in a great location, this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Super Location!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: airlinebrats
Reviews.Content: First I just have to say a big thank you to Jasmine at the front desk. Thanks to APEC being in town when we were there it was a challenge to get to the hotel. She stayed on the phone until we got within sight of hotel. So on that note the hotel staff could not have been any more friendly then they were, we just loved them. The location is one block from waikiki beach!!! The room decor is done in Ikea which I love!! The hotel itself is definately older but they have updated the furniture and such so its really hip and fun. The bathroom fixtures are old but the room was very clean. They had a blow dryer, ironing board in the room as well as an Ipod dock. We had small deck but we could see the water from it even though it was only a sliver. The only downside to this place is the fact its behind the Hyatt and that happens to be the bus pick up for all the tours that go out in the area. Now depending where you are from the noise may be an issue for you. We are use to noise when we sleep plus we had the ac running in the early am so it really wasnt an issue. The windows are very old in the hotel they are the slat style and some of those wouldnt shut so you could hear the buses for sure. However that noise on the street did not make a difference to us. We would so stay there again. Waikiki was great loved seeing sunset everynight and being that close to shops, restaurants and the beach was just the best!!! This hotel is fantastic for the money if you are looking for an infinity pool on the beach this place is not for you. (they also have free wifi) I hope this helps you pick your hotel next time you are in waikiki!! We cant wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Keep looking you can get a MUCH better hotel for nearly the same price.”
Reviews.Author: Hannah W
Reviews.Content: It felt a bit like I was sleeping in a tiny dorm. Basically everyone who books within an "unknown" amount of time can get a room for 80$/night. My advice to you is to go on Priceline and bid for a proper 3 star hotel where for 5$ more I got TWO beds, coffee/tea, fridge, a washroom I could comfortably fit into, unlimited calls from my hotel, enough lighting to see things in the dark, and a pool to swim in. Most of their rooms are really small, but some of the rooms are slightly larger. A lot of people review this place and say it's "affordable" because they haven't shopped around and didn't end up staying in a nearby hotel that gives you MUCH better bang for your buck. I wish the rest of my family had the chance to write this review.

Reviews.Title: “I really wanted to like this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tom B
Reviews.Content: I really did want to like this place--the descriptions of the quirky decor, great location, and the fact that it was newly renovated all were good selling points. And there were some things to like: very friendly staff, the location immediately across from the Hyatt's transportation center, the proximity to Waikiki beach and attractions, and the fact that many aspects of the room had been redone: new floors, paint, grout, molding, furniture, and a comfortable bed. Unfortunately there were also things not to like: extremely poor room lighting, no chair or desk in room, a bathroom faucet that was very difficult to turn on, noise coming through louvered glass windows (especially the end next to Koa Avenue), deadbolts that did not work (and in fact trapped us in the room for several minutes), lanai/balcony door locks that didn't work, and finally cockroaches (a big one in the tub and a small one running across the desk right in reception). We experienced three rooms over 2 stays, separated by a week. We coincidentally got one of the same rooms from our first visit on our second stay, and none of the defects we reported at the end of the first visit had been fixed--especially the non-functioning deadbolt lock. If the management will improve room lighting and fix all the door locks I would at least be able to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, Cozy, Affordable”
Reviews.Author: AnelaWings
Reviews.Content: I was just looking for a place to sleep for a night while on business. At starting rates at $79/nite, this newly renovated hotel was perfect. This clean, cute, boutique-like hotel has friendly and helpful service. It's located a short walk to the beach and surrounding shopping and restaurants. My overall rating would be higher if the renovation was complete. I'll be sure to return.

HotelInfo.Name: Stay Waikiki
HotelInfo.Address: 2424 Koa Avenue, Honolulu, Oahu, HI 96815
